intro: Parosela spiciformis, commonly known as the spiciform parosela, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of South America. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations between 2,000 and 4,000 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and erect. Parosela spiciformis is adapted to high-altitude environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
